articles.title: Kim Jong Il receives message from Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il receives message from Russia
    Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a message from Russian President B.N. Yeltsin on the occasion of Sun's Day.  The message said that the tradition of good-neighborliness and cooperation between Russia and Korea  that lasted for more than half a century has come to show renewed vitality in recent days. To further develop the relations between the countries accords with the interests of the two peoples and with the consolidation of the peace and stability in the Korean peninsula and northeast Asia, it stressed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends Educational Aid Fund and Stipends
       Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent educational aid fund and stipend of 119,900,000 yen  for the development of the democratic national education of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.   Educational Aid Fund and Stipend sent by President Kim Il Sung and Marshal Kim Jong Il in 144 installments for the children of the Korean residents in Japan total 
44,038,163,000 yen.

articles.title: Military attaches' corps in Korea visits 1st Kimilsungia Show
articles.content:
Military attaches' corps in Korea visits 1st Kimilsungia Show
      Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- The military attaches' corps in Korea on Wednesday visited the 1st Kimilsungia Show on the occasion of Sun's Day.   They looked with keen interest round Kimilsungia symbolizing the greatness of the President Kim Il Sung. Indonesian military attach Nelson Mallau wrote in the visitor's book that Kimilsungia is associated with the ardent reverence of the Indonesian people for Kim Il Sung and that,  seeing the flower, he deeply felt how high and absolute the prestige of the President is.

articles.title: Talks between WPK and CPB(ML)
articles.content:
Talks between WPK and CPB(ML)
        Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Worker's Party of Korea, had  talks with Dilip Barua, general secretary of the c.c., the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), in Pyongyang on Wednesday.    At the talks, both sides informed each other of their party's activities and exchanged views on the development of the friendly relations between the two parties and on a series of matters of common concern.

articles.title: Greetings to Danish Queen
articles.content:
Greetings to Danish Queen
   Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Danish Queen Margrethe II on Wednesday on the occasion of the National Day of Denmark, her birthday.   The message wished good health and happiness to her and progress and prosperity to the Danish people.

articles.title: Meetings commemorate Kim Il Sung's birthday
Literature carrying Portrait of Kim Il Sung scattered
articles.content:
Literature carrying Portrait of Kim Il Sung scattered in Seoul
    Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- 1,100 copies of literatureï¿½@carrying a Portrait of the President Kim Il Sung were scattered in central, Mapho and Kangnam districts of Seoul on April 14, on the eve of Sun's Day, according to a radio report from Seoul.   Printed on the front of the literature was a color portrait of the President and on the back were words of a song "Let's sing of Sun's Day."

articles.title: Cuban ambassador hosts reception
Floral basket laid before Kim Il Sung's statue
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Kim Il Sung's statue
   Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- Representative David Morton and members of the mission of the world food program here on April 14 laid a floral basket before the statue of the President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on the occasion of Sun's Day.   Written on the ribbon  hanging on the floral basket were letters "The great leader comrade Kim Il Sung will live forever."

articles.title: Friendly gathering with Mongolian artistes
Floral baskets, gifts and letters to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral baskets, gifts and letters to Kim Jong Il
      Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received floral baskets, gifts and congratulatory letters from foreign diplomatic representatives and embassies in Korea on the occasion of Sun's Day.  They were conveyed to officials concerned by diplomatic representatives and embassies of Cambodia, Laos, Libya, Ethiopia, India, Pakistan, Russia, Palestine, Egypt, Vietnam, Iran, Poland and Yemen.
Congratulatory letters to Kim Jong Il were also handed to officials concerned by the UNICEF resident representativeï¿½@and the acting UNDP resident representative in Korea and the military attaches of the embassies of Vietnam, Iran and Egypt.

articles.title: Gifts to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, April 15 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from the delegation of the Finland-Korea  Association, general secretary of c.c., the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist) Dilip Barua, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI) Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Kim Il Sung Prize Council and director of the board of the IIJI Vishwanath and director of the board of the IIJI Prof. And Dr.  Alexander Kovalyov of Moscow State University of Russia, on a visit to Korea.   The gifts were conveyed to the officials concerned.
